scenarios.name: Year Navigation with Integrated Header
scenarios.description: Test the redesigned header that integrates year navigation buttons with the title (REQ-1, REQ-2, US-1). Year appears only once in an integrated design: '← 2024 →' as part of the page header, eliminating duplicate year displays.

steps.description: Navigate to the main gallery page without any year parameter
steps.context: User lands on the application for the first time

steps.description: Confirm the header displays navigation arrows integrated with the year (e.g., '← 2024 →') and the page title shows 'In {year},' or similar contextual text that works with the header design
steps.context: No duplicate year displays - year should appear only once in the header navigation area

steps.action: Click left arrow to go to previous year
steps.description: Click on the left arrow (←) button to navigate to the previous year
steps.context: User wants to view past media consumption

steps.action: Verify page navigates to previous year
steps.description: Confirm the page displays media consumption for the previous year and URL updates
steps.context: URL should change to reflect the year path (e.g., /2025)

steps.action: Click right arrow to go to next year
steps.description: Click on the right arrow (→) button to navigate back
steps.context: User wants to return to more recent year

steps.description: Verify left arrow is disabled/hidden on earliest year and right arrow is disabled/hidden on latest year
steps.context: Arrows should be disabled at year boundaries

test_cases.expected: Header displays integrated year navigation (e.g., '← 2024 →') with year shown once, not duplicated in a separate location
Page navigates to 2025, URL changes to /2025, header updates to show 2025
Page navigates to 2026, URL changes to /2026, header updates to show 2026
Left arrow is disabled or visually hidden, right arrow is enabled
Right arrow is disabled or visually hidden, left arrow is enabled
Component displays left arrow, current year prominently, and right arrow in a clean integrated design
Year appears only once in the UI (not in both navigation and title)

scenarios.name: API Performance Optimization - Parallel Requests
scenarios.description: Test that the backend API fetches movie and TV data in parallel instead of sequentially to stay within Vercel's 10s function limit

steps.action: Request screen data for a year
steps.description: Call GET /api/complete/screen/2024 endpoint
steps.context: Backend needs to fetch both movie and TV data from NeoDB

steps.description: Backend should fetch movie and TV data concurrently using asyncio or threading
steps.context: Vercel serverless functions have 10s timeout limit

steps.description: Total response time should be significantly less than sequential approach
steps.context: Parallel fetch should roughly halve the response time

test_cases.expected: Response returns within 10 seconds (Vercel limit)
Uses concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor or asyncio to fetch movie and TV in parallel
Pagination for both movie and TV happens concurrently

test_cases.input: One category has data, other is empty
test_cases.expected: Returns combined result correctly regardless of data distribution

steps.description: Backend makes only as many NeoDB requests as needed
steps.context: Performance optimization by avoiding redundant requests

Loop terminates when oldest item's created_time < start_date_of_year
